title: India’s Aditya-L1 solar observatory enters orbit around Lagrange point
summary: India’s Aditya-L1 solar observatory has reached its destination orbit around Sun-Earth Lagrange point 1 around 1.5 million kilometers from Earth.

title: Vulcan on the pad for its first launch
summary: After a decade of development, United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur rocket is finally on the launch pad for its inaugural launch, carrying not just a lunar lander but also the company’s future.

title: Space Force on the verge of finalizing long-awaited commercial space strategy
summary: The commercial space strategy will guide the Space Force's integration of commercial satellite services into its routine operations.

title: With Solo Vehicle Testing Complete Flight 3 is Getting Closer
summary: Preparations for the third flight of Starship are making solid progress after both vehicles completed their respective solo test campaigns. Booster 10 rolled back to the Shipyard for final mods and checkouts before its flight, and Ship 28 wasn’t far behind. Both vehicles are now in their Bays for final work before rolling back to the launch site for integrated stack testing and launch.

title: As Vulcan nears debut, it’s not clear whether ULA will live long and prosper
summary: This marks an absolutely pivotal moment for the 20-year-old launch company.

title: Space security in the Americas can no longer go overlooked
summary: Countries in Latin America can no longer afford to ignore space as a major influence over national autonomy and security.

title: Daily Telescope: A crab found in the night sky rather than the world’s oceans
summary: Oh, to have seen this supernova back in the day.

title: China completes new commercial launch pad to boost access to space
summary: A newly-completed launch pad on China’s Hainan island could increase China’s access to space, boosting national constellation projects and commercial launch plans.

title: RFA Boosts Argo Capabilities to Answer ESA Commercial Cargo Call
summary:
German launch provider Rocket Factory Augsburg announced early last month that it had increased the payload capability of its Argo cargo spacecraft. The boost in performance was required to meet the updated base performance specifications of a European Space Agency call for commercial cargo services to and from low Earth orbit (LEO). The post RFA Boosts Argo Capabilities to Answer ESA Commercial Cargo Call appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA instruments set to fly on Peregrine commercial lunar lander
summary: As NASA prepares for the first launch of a commercial lunar lander carrying agency-sponsored payloads, it is trying to balance the science it can achieve with the challenges of landing on the moon and other emerging concerns.
